H0.text: Perspiration rids the body of excess water, which is the primary role of perspiration in humans.

H1.text: Perspiration eliminates bacteria from the skin, which is the primary role of perspiration in humans.

H2.text: Perspiration opens skin pores to absorb more oxygen.

H3.text: Perspiration helps to maintain a stable body temperature in humans.

A4.text: Sweating causes a decrease in core temperature through evaporative cooling at the skin surface.

A5.text: Sweat contributes to body odor when it is metabolized by bacteria on the skin.
